member.name: T:Innovative.Geometry.Angle
member.summary: Defines a type for a geometric angle that allows various ways of setting and converting the values from and to different modes. Angle inherently is a decimal and can be used in place of a decimal when specifically referring to a geometric angle with the value being the degrees of the angle.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the System.Angle class.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the System.Angle class to an angle specified in degrees represented by an integer.
member.param: The value of the angle in degrees.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.#ctor(System.Decimal)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the System.Angle class to an angle specified in degrees represented by a decimal.
member.param: The value of the angle in degrees.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.#ctor(System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the System.Angle class to an angle specified in degrees represented by a double.
member.param: The value of the angle in degrees.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Decimal)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the System.Angle class to an angle with the whole part specified in degrees represented by a integer and the decimal part represented in Minutes and Seconds of an Arc. This allows an angle represented as 9° 14' 55.8'' to be initialized.
member.param: The whole value portion of the angle in degrees, e.g., 9 from the angle 9° 14' 55.8''.
The arcminute value, e.g., 14 from the angle 9° 14' 55.8''.
The arcsecond value, e.g., 55.8 from the angle 9° 14' 55.8''.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the System.Angle class to an angle with the whole part specified in degrees represented by a System.Int32 and the System.Double part represented in Minutes and Seconds of an Arc. This allows an angle represented as 9° 14' 55.8'' to be initialized.
member.param: The whole value portion of the angle in degrees, e.g., 9 from the angle 9° 14' 55.8''.
The arcminute value, e.g., 14 from the angle 9° 14' 55.8''.
The arcsecond value, e.g., 55.8 from the angle 9° 14' 55.8''.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.RadiansMultiplied(System.Decimal)
member.summary: Returns the value of this instance in Radian units by first multiplying the underlying value of the angle (in degrees) by the multiplier before converting the value to Radian units. Note that this value is NOT equal to this.Radians * multiplier.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.RadiansDivided(System.Decimal)
member.summary: Returns the value of this instance in Radian units by first dividing the underlying value of the angle (in degrees) by the divisor before converting the value to Radian units. Note that this value is NOT equal to this.Radians / divisor.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.Reduce
member.summary: Normalizes this instance of the angle to between 0 and 360 degrees.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether this instance and a specified System.Angle object represent the same value.
member.param: A System.Angle object to compare to this instance.
member.returns: True if obj is equal to this instance; False otherwise.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer hash code.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.op_Implicit(Innovative.Geometry.Angle)~System.Decimal
member.summary: Defines an implicit conversion of a System.Angle object to a System.Decimal object.
member.returns: The converted object.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.op_Implicit(Innovative.Geometry.Angle)~System.Double
member.summary: Defines an implicit conversion of a System.Angle object to a System.Double object.
member.returns: The converted object.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.op_Implicit(System.Decimal)~Innovative.Geometry.Angle
member.summary: Defines an implicit conversion of a System.Decimal object to a System.Angle object.
member.returns: The converted object.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.op_Implicit(System.Double)~Innovative.Geometry.Angle
member.summary: Defines an implicit conversion of a System.Double object to a System.Angle object.
member.returns: The converted object.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.op_Addition(Innovative.Geometry.Angle,Innovative.Geometry.Angle)
member.summary: Adds two Angles.
member.returns: The result of the first Angle being added to the second Angle.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.op_Subtraction(Innovative.Geometry.Angle,Innovative.Geometry.Angle)
member.summary: Subtracts one Angle from another.
member.returns: The result of the second Angle being subtracted from the first Angle.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.op_Multiply(Innovative.Geometry.Angle,Innovative.Geometry.Angle)
member.summary: Multiplies two Angles.
member.returns: The result of the first Angle being multiplied by the second Angle.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.op_Division(Innovative.Geometry.Angle,Innovative.Geometry.Angle)
member.summary: Divides two Angles.
member.returns: The result of the first Angle being divided by the second Angle.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.op_Modulus(Innovative.Geometry.Angle,Innovative.Geometry.Angle)
member.summary: Calculates the modulo of two Angles.
member.returns: The result of the First Angle mod the Second Angle.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.op_Increment(Innovative.Geometry.Angle)
member.summary: Increments an Angle by 1 degree.
member.returns: The result of the Angle being incremented by 1 degree.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.op_Decrement(Innovative.Geometry.Angle)
member.summary: Decrements an Angle by 1 degree.
member.returns: The result of the Angle being decremented by 1 degree.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.op_Equality(Innovative.Geometry.Angle,Innovative.Geometry.Angle)
member.summary: Determines if two Angles are equal.
member.returns: True if the two angle are the same, False otherwise.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.op_Inequality(Innovative.Geometry.Angle,Innovative.Geometry.Angle)
member.summary: Determines if two Angles are not equal.
member.returns: True if the two angle are the not same, False otherwise.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.op_GreaterThan(Innovative.Geometry.Angle,Innovative.Geometry.Angle)
member.summary: Determines one Angle is greater than another Angle.
member.returns: True if the first Angle is greater than the second Angle, False otherwise.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.op_GreaterThanOrEqual(Innovative.Geometry.Angle,Innovative.Geometry.Angle)
member.summary: Determines one Angle is greater than or equal to another Angle.
member.returns: True if the first Angle is greater than or equal to the second Angle, False otherwise.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.op_LessThan(Innovative.Geometry.Angle,Innovative.Geometry.Angle)
member.summary: Determines one Angle is less than another Angle.
member.returns: True if the first Angle is less than the second Angle, False otherwise.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.op_LessThanOrEqual(Innovative.Geometry.Angle,Innovative.Geometry.Angle)
member.summary: Determines one Angle is less than or equal to another Angle.
member.returns: True if the first Angle is less than or equal to the second Angle, False otherwise.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.op_LogicalNot(Innovative.Geometry.Angle)
member.summary: Reverses the direction of an Angle by adding 180 degrees.
member.returns: The result of the Angle being reversed.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.ToDegrees(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Decimal)
member.summary: Converts the value of an angle specified in degree, arcminute and arcsecond values to a decimal-precision floating-point value of the angle. For example an angle specified as as 9° 14' 55.8'' can be converted to a decimal.
member.param: The whole value portion of the angle in degrees, e.g., 9 from the angle 9° 14' 55.8''.
The arcminute value, e.g., 14 from the angle 9° 14' 55.8''.
The arcsecond value, e.g., 55.8 from the angle 9° 14' 55.8''.
member.returns: The decimal-precision floating-point value of the specified angle.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.ToDegrees(System.Decimal)
member.summary: Converts a radian angle to degrees.
member.returns: The angle in degree units.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.ToRadians(System.Decimal)
member.summary: A radian is the measure of a central angle subtending an arc equal in length to the radius. This method converts an angle measured in degrees to radian units.
member.returns: The angle in radian units.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.FromRadians(System.Decimal)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the System.Angle class from the specified angle expressed in Radian units.
member.returns: A new instance of the System.Angle class.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.GetDegrees(Innovative.Geometry.Angle)
member.summary: Gets the whole number portion of the value of the given instance of Angle.
member.returns: An integer value representing the whole number portion of the angle.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.GetArcminute(Innovative.Geometry.Angle)
member.summary: A minute of arc, arcminute, is a unit of angular measurement equal to one sixtieth (1⁄60) of one degree. This method returns the arcminute portion of the given Angle.
member.param: An instance of the System.Angle class.
member.returns: The arcminute of the specified angle.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.GetArcsecond(Innovative.Geometry.Angle)
member.summary: A second of arc or arcsecond is one sixtieth (1⁄60) of one arcminute. This method returns the arcsecond portion of the given Angle.
member.param: An instance of the System.Angle class.
member.returns: The arcminute of the specified angle.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.Reduce(Innovative.Geometry.Angle)
member.summary: Normalizes an angle to between 0 and 360 degrees.
member.param: The angle in degrees to be reduced.
member.returns: A representation of the given Angle in degrees where the value is between 0 and 360.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a angle expressed as a number to its decimal-precision floating-point number equivalent in degree units.
member.param: A string that contains a number to convert.
member.returns: An instance of System.Angle instantiated with the parsed value.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.TryParse(System.String,Innovative.Geometry.Angle@)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a angle expressed as a number to its decimal-precision floating-point number equivalent in degree units. A return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed.
member.param: A string that contains a number to convert.
An instance of System.Angle instantiated with the parsed value.
member.returns: True if s was converted successfully; False otherwise.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.ToString
member.summary: Converts the value of this instance to its equivalent string representation.
member.returns: The string representation of the value of this instance.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.ToShortFormat
member.summary: The string representation of the value of this instance using the common symbol for degrees and a decimal value for the portion that is less than zero.
member.returns: The short format string representation of the value of this instance.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.ToLongFormat
member.summary: The string representation of the value of this instance displayed in degrees, arcminutes and arcseonds.
member.returns: The long format string representation of the value of this instance.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares this instance with a specified object and indicates whether this instance precedes, follows, or appears in the same position as the specified System.Angle.
member.param: The object to compare with this instance.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer that indicates whether this instance precedes, follows, or appears in the same position as the value parameter. Value Condition Less than zero: This instance precedes obj. Zero: This instance has the same position as obj. Greater than zero: This instance follows obj or obj is null.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.ToString(System.String,System.IFormatProvider)
member.summary: Converts the numeric value of this instance to its equivalent string representation using the specified culture-specific format information.
member.param: An object that supplies culture-specific formatting information.
member.returns: The string representation of the value of this instance as specified by format and provider.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.CompareTo(Innovative.Geometry.Angle)
member.summary: Compares this instance with a specified System.Angle object and indicates whether this instance precedes, follows, or appears in the same position as the specified System.Angle.
member.param: The angle to compare with this instance.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer that indicates whether this instance precedes, follows, or appears in the same position as the value parameter. Value Condition Less than zero: This instance precedes obj. Zero: This instance has the same position as obj. Greater than zero: This instance follows other or other is null.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.Equals(Innovative.Geometry.Angle)
member.summary: Specifies whether this Angle and the specified Angle have the same value.
member.param: The Angle to compare to this instance.
member.returns: True if the value of the other parameter is the same as this Angle; False otherwise

member.name: P:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.Degrees
member.summary: Gets the whole number portion of the value of this instance in degrees.

member.name: P:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.Arcminute
member.summary: Gets the arcminute portion of the value of this instance in degrees.

member.name: P:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.Arcsecond
member.summary: Gets the arcsecond portion of the value of this instance in degrees.

member.name: P:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.Radians
member.summary: Returns the value of this instance in Radian units.

member.name: P:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.TotalArcminutes
member.summary: Gets the full value of this angle expressed only in Minutes of arc.

member.name: P:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.TotalArcseconds
member.summary: Gets the full value of this angle expressed only in Seconds of arc.

member.name: P:Innovative.Geometry.Angle.Empty
member.summary: Represents the empty Angle. This field is read-only.

member.name: T:Innovative.Geometry.Numbers
member.summary: Provides decimal based mathematical constants.

member.name: P:Innovative.Geometry.Numbers.Pi
member.summary: Gets the value of PI.

member.name: T:Innovative.Geometry.Universal
member.summary: Provides common .NET static methods that vary between versions.

member.name: T:Innovative.Geometry.Universal.Math
member.summary: The Math functions in PORTABLE libraries only accept and return double. All other libraries accept decimal. The library works in all decimal values. This class provides decimal based Math functions for all platforms.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Universal.Math.Floor(System.Decimal)
member.summary: Returns the largest integer less than or equal to the specified double-precision floating-point number.
member.returns: The largest integer less than or equal to d. If d is equal to System.Double.NaN, System.Double.NegativeInfinity, or System.Double.PositiveInfinity, that value is returned.

member.name: M:Innovative.Geometry.Universal.Math.Ceiling(System.Decimal)
member.summary: Returns the smallest integral value that is greater than or equal to the specified double-precision floating-point number.
member.returns: The smallest integral value that is greater than or equal to a. If a is equal to System.Double.NaN, System.Double.NegativeInfinity, or System.Double.PositiveInfinity, that value is returned. Note that this method returns a System.Double instead of an integral type.
